channel.title: Dynamic BCEL Updater
channel.description:
Hey there guys, messing around with the Wurm Online Client.
I have got it downloading the jar and extracting the class files, dumping them to a new jar(will be editing them before dumping at a later point), all done at runtime.
The problem I have is that the jar will not run successfully unless the file "META-INF/ONETOOFR.SF" is in the jar. It will only run if I extract this file from the original .jar and then copy it into the "dumped" .jar using windows explorer/winrar. I have tried numerous ways to add this file and have it still work, such as: Reading the file and adding it to the jar Adding the java using command line: Runtime.getRuntime().exec("jar uf dump.jar META-INF/ONETOOFR.SF");
Neither of these methods seem to work, but when I extract the file and run a comparison between the two, they are EXACTLY the same.
Any help would be greatly appreciated!
Thanks in advance,
Verlix.

item.title: Dynamic BCEL Updater
item.dc:creator: @shangtsung1 shangtsung1
item.description:
@shangtsung1 wrote:

[quote=“Verlix, post:6, topic:395455”]Yeah I know, but I launch this via a .bat file:
java -Xms1400M -cp .;dump.jar com.updater.Main

dump.jar contains this file, I just don’t understand where this error is coming from.[/quote]

lol i had that problem once, the winrar repair tool fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic BCEL Updater
item.dc:creator: @Verlix Verlix
item.description:
@Verlix wrote:

Tried singing the jar myself, and I still receive this error:

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/wurmonline/client
/WurmLauncher
at com.updater.Main.main(Main.java:59)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.wurmonline.client.WurmLauncher
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
… 1 more

Anybody got any clues?

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic BCEL Updater

item.description:
@frank wrote:

why not just remove the check?

item.title: Dynamic BCEL Updater
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That’s a file from someone who signed the jar, once you edit a jar, it is no good anymore, so you shouldn’t be putting it in there, you may have to sign the jar yourself though, have you tried that?

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic BCEL Updater
item.dc:creator: @Verlix Verlix
item.description:
@Verlix wrote:

Hey there guys, messing around with the Wurm Online Client.

I have got it downloading the jar and extracting the class files, dumping them to a new jar(will be editing them before dumping at a later point), all done at runtime.

The problem I have is that the jar will not run successfully unless the file “META-INF/ONETOOFR.SF” is in the jar. It will only run if I extract this file from the original .jar and then copy it into the “dumped” .jar using windows explorer/winrar. I have tried numerous ways to add this file and have it still work, such as:
Reading the file and adding it to the jar
Adding the java using command line: Runtime.getRuntime().exec(“jar uf dump.jar META-INF/ONETOOFR.SF”);

Neither of these methods seem to work, but when I extract the file and run a comparison between the two, they are EXACTLY the same.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,

Verlix.

Read full topic
